title: Extensive Agricultural Land
description: In 2022, 84.55% of Turkmenistan's land area was dedicated to agriculture, one of the highest percentages globally.

title: High Fossil Fuel Dependency
description: In 2022, Turkmenistan's energy consumption was entirely reliant on fossil fuels, marking a 100% dependency rate.

title: Universal Prenatal Care
description: In 2019, 100% of pregnant women in Turkmenistan received prenatal care, ensuring comprehensive maternal health services.

title: Minimal Open Defecation in Rural Areas
description: By 2018, only 0.0026% of the rural population practiced open defecation, reflecting significant sanitation improvements.

title: High Out-of-Pocket Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, 79.22% of health expenditures were out-of-pocket, indicating a heavy financial burden on individuals.

title: Strong Female Labor Force Participation
description: In 2024, the female-to-male labor force participation rate was 104.66%, showcasing gender parity in employment.

title: High Consumption of Iodized Salt
description: In 2015, 99.7% of households consumed iodized salt, promoting better nutritional health.

title: Low Renewable Electricity Output
description: In 2021, only 0.011% of Turkmenistan's electricity output was from renewable sources, indicating minimal green energy adoption.

title: Significant Domestic Private Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, 84.50% of health expenditures were privately funded, highlighting a reliance on private health financing.

title: Limited Voice and Accountability
description: In 2023, Turkmenistan scored 0.49 in the Voice and Accountability percentile rank, reflecting limited political freedoms.

title: Low Control of Corruption
description: In 2022, Turkmenistan's control of corruption ranked at 0.47, indicating challenges in governance and transparency.

title: Limited Statistical Data Services
description: In 2023, Turkmenistan scored 0.47 in the Statistical Performance Indicators for data services, suggesting room for improvement in data management.

title: Negative Aid Flows from Norway
description: In 2019, Turkmenistan experienced a net negative aid flow of -$20,000 from Norway, indicating a financial outflow.

title: Positive Official Flows from UN Agencies
description: In 2022, Turkmenistan received $13,054 from UN agencies, reflecting international support.

title: Low Adolescents Out of School Rate
description: In 2022, only 0.02% of female adolescents were out of school, highlighting strong educational retention.

title: High Merchandise Imports from Europe & Central Asia
description: In 2023, 45.24% of Turkmenistan's merchandise imports were from Europe & Central Asia, indicating strong regional trade ties.
